section.p: The Tag Style Dialog allows you to change the representation details of Tag Mode.

li.p: Block indent specifies the default block indentation of blocks presented in Tag Mode.
Tag font specifies the font metrics used for tag names.
Interlacing block colors specify background colors for the interlacing parent and child blocks.
The Namespace Colors section specifies how tags that belong to different namespaces will be colored. The namespaces are distinguished with their URIs (not prefixes).
Show non-breakable spaces as a circles indicates whether the non-breakable spaces (nbsp) should be shown visually as a small circles, not just spaces.
System font specifies the font for menus, dialogs, etc.
Document location (windows) specifies the default document location for new documents.
Default spelling dictionary specifies the spelling dictionary that will be used when invoking spell checker.
Context Hints specifies the context hints behaviour:
Enabled specifies if context hints are shown.
Persistent specifies if the context hints go away after timeout.
Hide after specifies the timeout after which the context hints go away.

Save document line-breaks allows you to force saving of XML document with specific line-breaks, disregarding of the OS the Serna is used on. By default serna saves documents without line-feeds on UNIX and Mac OS X, and with line-feeds on Windows.
Reset to Factory Settings will reset all settings you specified in both Preferences and the GUI customization to the default settings.

note.p: Reset to Factory Settings will not affect GUI customization made through templates.

li.p: XML files path specify paths that are used in document templates, New Document Dialog, and Open Document Dialog with variable $SERNA_XML.

note.p: The XML files path is for advanced operations only. Serna looks for its configuration files within this path ($SERNA_XML).

li.p: Path to additional plugins directory specify additional path, where user may dispose plugins for Serna. This is useful when the plugins are placed somewhere on a shared file system or separate disk that survives reinstalling.
The applications table allows you to specify external applications for viewing published files (see ).

section.p: To add new file extensions to the Open Dialog and Open with Template Dialog use the File Types tab. Just add space-separated wild-card values (e.g. *.xhtml *.html) and a description (e.g. XHTML files).
Serna fully supports OASIS XML Catalogs (Committee Specification 06 Aug 2001).

li.p: To add new catalogs, put the path to the catalog file into the list of catalogs (e.g. with the Add... button). Note that the list should be semicolon-separated in Windows, and colon-separated for Linux and Mac OS X.
To change the default match mode, check Public or System in Default Match Mode .

Serna understands the $XML_CATALOG_FILES variable, that is expected to contain the list of system XML Catalogs (semicolon-separated for Windows, and colon-separated for Linux and Mac OS X). Note that catalogs that come first override those following.

If the specified SYSID is not an absolute path, then Serna tries to find it relative to the paths that are listed in Preferences->XML Catalogs->DTD Search Path. Alternate paths are semicolon-separated in Windows, and colon-separated in Linux and Mac OS X.
The default value for the DTD search path is: sernaInstallationPath/xml/dtds.

note.p: It is also possible to specify the XML Catalog file only for the specific document template. See , xml-catalogs property.

section.p:
This tab specifies the following parameters:
Large document folding parameters.
When opening a document, Serna estimates the length of the document. It counts elements in the document, and divides the result by an average number of elements per page. (This number is usually specific to the current document template).
Note, that this estimation is not exact, and only prevents you from lengthy formatting if the document is suspected to be very large.
You can set the number of pages after which Serna should consider the document as large.
If Serna considers the document as large, it may collapse some elements, open the document normally, or ask the user.
Undo/Redo stack depth.
It is possible to set the maximum undo/redo stack depth to limit memory consumption. Allowed values are between 10 and 9999. The default value is 30.
